post_title.text: Bri11iant: An Extension for Building Accessible Websites

post_preview_description.text: Bri11iant is a VSCode language extension for supporting web developers improve the accessibility of their websites. The goal of Bri11iant is to help make the internet a more inclusive place by providing developers with in-editor support for vital accessibility standards and inclusive design principles.

node.post_author: C. Barth and T. B. McHugh

post_title.text: V11: A JavaScript Library For Building A11Y Workflows

post_preview_description.text: Input device interfaces, accessibility APIs, and screen extensions often use platform-dependent and low-level programming interfaces that are not well-documented. V11, a JavaScript library was built to power the next generation of assistive tools and workflows. The engine exposes accessibility and automation programming interfaces in a language that abstracts complex actions into a simple tree for querying and manipulating. Just like the web, it's easy to learn for beginners, and powerful enough for the most experienced developers.

post_title.text: Andrew: An Artificial Network for Digital Recording Event Windows

post_preview_description.text: A sound-object labelling machine learning model for use as an Audacity script. Uses VGGish for feature extraction and a Pytorch N-way classifier neural network for training.
